abstract.text: An interaction object that you use to display relevant actions for your content.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object to focus the user’s attention on a specific portion of your content, and to provide actions for the user to perform on that content. A context menu interaction object tracks Force Touch gestures on devices that support 3D Touch, and long-press gestures on devices that don’t support it. When the appropriate gesture occurs, this object animates your content to a new interface and displays the contextual menu that you supplied. UIKit manages all menu-related interactions and reports the selected action, if any, back to your app.

method to attach it to one of your views. The delegate object you provide must adopt the
protocol. Use the methods of that object to provide the contents of the contextual menu. Add your context menu interaction object to a view in your interface using the view’s

The object that provides the preview and contextual menu for your content and responds to interaction-related events.

The appearance of the context menu.

The methods for providing the set of actions to perform on your content, and for customizing the preview of that content.
The protocol that an interaction implements to access the view that owns it.
Additional parameters to use when animating a preview interface.
An object that specifies the container view to use for animations.
An object describing the view to use during preview-related animations.
Adds an interaction to the view.
Provide quick access to useful actions by adding context menus to your iOS app.

The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.

A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
